required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Power Production in Older Adults With Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Power Production in Older Adults With Knee Osteoarthritis Compared to Healthy Counterparts

brief_summary.textblock: Knee osteoarthritis is an important cause of functional disabilities at old age. Previous research has demonstrated that individuals with knee osteoarthritis have reduced knee-extensor strength in comparison to healthy individuals. However, rapid power production declines more than strength as a consequence of ageing and is more predictive of functional capacity. However, limited research has investigated whether individuals with knee osteoarthritis have reduced ability to develop strength and power rapidly on top of reduced maximal strength capacities, which is the primary aim of the current study.

primary_outcome.description: Subjects perform a test protocol on a Biodex dynamometer, consisting of isotonic contractions of the leg-extensor muscles. Subjects are instructed to kick as fast as possible against different (relative) loads. The rate of power development (watt/s) is defined as the linear slope of the power-time curve and is measured from the onset of movement till peak power.

secondary_outcome.description: Maximal strength (Nm) is measured by means of unilateral isometric knee-extensor tests on a Biodex dynamometer.
Maximal strength (Nm) is measured by means of unilateral isokinetic knee-extensor tests on a Biodex dynamometer.
Stair ascent duration (in s), the time needed to ascent a flight of stairs.
The average speed to walk 10m as fast as possible (in m/s).
The time needed to perform 5 sit-to-stand transitions (in s).
The time needed to stand up from a chair, walk 3m, turn, walk back and sit down.
Handgrip strength (kg) evaluated with Jamar dynamometer.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Older adults with knee osteoarthritis (>50 years)

intervention.description: Power and strength tests of the knee-extensor muscles, handgrip strength, functional capacity tests
intervention.arm_group_label: Older adults with knee osteoarthritis (>50 years)

study_pop.textblock: Adults between 50 and 80 years with or without knee osteoarthritis. Subjects are sedentary or recreationally active.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Group with knee osteoarthritis:
- Diagnosed with knee osteoarthritis based on RX.
Exclusion Criteria:
Healthy group:
- Systematic engagement in (resistance) exercise in the 12-months prior to participation
- Cardiovascular disease
- Neurological disorders
- Cognitive malfunctioning
- Severe knee or hip problems
Group with knee osteoarthritis:
- Systematic engagement in (resistance) exercise in the 12-months prior to participation
- Cardiovascular disease
- Neurological disorders
- Cognitive malfunctioning
- Severe hip problems
